definitions.definition: A census , an enumeration , a review , a survey .
A critical revision of a text .
A text established by critical revision.
A family of manuscripts which share similar traits ; the variety of a language which is used in such manuscripts.
examples: The existence of two major literary centres in the First Bulgarian Empire led to the emergence of two recensions of Old Church Slavonic: the Bulgarian Recension and the Macedonian Recension .
The Russian recension of Old Church Slavonic emerged after the 10th century and was characterized by the substitution of /u/ for the nasal sound /õ/ .

main_definition: A census , an enumeration , a review , a survey .
secondary_definitions: A critical revision of a text .
A text established by critical revision.
A family of manuscripts which share similar traits ; the variety of a language which is used in such manuscripts.
